content:
Use Data Privacy Day (today) to learn what Privacy really is. Its not what you think, it is much more.
https://iapp.org/connect/data-privacy-day/
I explain the scope (bit dated 2015, but still accurate) https://healthcaresecprivacy.blogspot.com/2015/04/privacy-principles.html
But I locked the door to the server room. How much more privacy do people want?

David Pyke said:

But I locked the door to the server room. How much more privacy do people want?

Ill sign you up for a session with John Wunderlich
If you need the key for the server room, it's on top of the fire extinguisher :)

Hey, only the server admins and people with clearance should use that key! Oh, and the cleaners... and the maintenance guy because the breaker panel is in there... right, and the receptionist because she likes to have her lunch in there.

But nobody else!
Also, the door is propped open with a broom because the contractors are working and it was a hassle going through the procedures every time.

That https://iapp.org/connect/data-privacy-day/ only has a single tracker enabled (google analytics) and has marketing cookies off by default with opt-in. Not too bad. The site got a C+ from DuckDuckGo (lots of caveats on how that is measured of course).
